heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: The last storm was on 03 October 2025 which lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (183°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (232.0°) by approximately 49.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the outside temperature (down 1.8°C) and feels like temperature (down 1.6°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 6%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 505 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 513 m) and outside temperature (up 1.6°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 505.1m lower than yesterday, 283.2m lower than the past week, 513.4m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 901m to a maximum of 2830m, averaging 1121.5m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1404.7m and 1634.9m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: Cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times.

dew point temperature.description:
Today’s average dew point temperature is 0.5°C lower than yesterday, 0.9°C lower than the past week, 0.2°C higher than the past month.

The dew point temperatures yesterday fell between 5.1°C minimum and 11.9°C maximum, with an average of 9.5°C; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 10.4°C and 9.3°C.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; you can expect comfortable, mild temperatures. Also, air moisture should feel ok and near calm conditions. Possible light showers, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and the light is absent. No significant shifts in the weather are expected.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (90%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
